int min_debug ( const char *  func_name,
unsigned int  lineno,
const char *  file_name,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Writes debug message to log. Use through macros MIN_DEBUGXX.

Returns:
0 always
Parameters:
func_name function from which debug is called
lineno linenumber of the c-file the debug message deals with
file_name name of the file calling debug
format message formatting string as in e.g. printf (3)

int min_emerg ( const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Writes min emergency message to log. The message is printed also to console.

0 always

int min_log_close (  ) 

Closes the min logger facility

int min_log_open ( const char *  identifier,
unsigned int  debug_level 
)

Opens the min log facility. Call ones per program execution.

Returns:
0 when ok, 1 if the debug level is invalid (not 0-3)
Parameters:
identifier will be prepended to all log messges
debug_level the debug level to be used
See also:
min_debug_level

  ... 
)

Writes min warning message to log.

Returns:
0 always
Parameters:
format message formatting string as in e.g. printf (3)

Variable Documentation

unsigned int min_debug_level

global variable for debug level. values 0 - no debug 1 - some debug. 2 - more debug. 3 - most debug.
